column1: Volume Number#Year Published#English Title#French Title#Main Setting#Plot

1#1961#Asterix the Gaul#Astérix le Gaulois#Asterix's village and Roman camp Compendium (no travel)#The Romans discover the secret of the Gauls' strength is the magic potion brewed by the druid Getafix
column2: so they capture him and attempt to get the recipe out of him.

column1: 2#1962#Asterix and the Golden Sickle#La Serpe d'or#Lutetia (Paris)#Getafix's sickle breaks
column2: so Asterix and Obelix volunteer to go to Lutetia to buy a new one. But there is a mysterious sickle shortage our heroes must get to the bottom of.

column1: 3#1963#Asterix and the Goths#Astérix et les Goths#Germany#The druid Getafix is captured by a tribe of Goths
column2: and Asterix and Obelix must rescue him.

column1: 4#1964#Asterix the Gladiator#Astérix gladiateur#Rome#Odius Asparagus
column2: the prefect of Gaul
column3: captures Cacofonix and sends him as a present to Caesar. Unimpressed by the bard
column4: Caesar orders him to be thrown to the lions at the Circus Maximus.

column1: 5#1965#Asterix and the Banquet#Le Tour de Gaule d'Astérix#Various French cities#Unsuccessful at conquering the village
column2: the Romans decide to isolate it by building a stockade. To remove it
column3: Asterix strikes a bet with the Romans that he and Obelix can travel throughout Gaul and back to the village with various Gaulish delicacies without the Romans being able to stop them.

column1: 6#1965#Asterix and Cleopatra#Astérix et Cléopâtre#Egypt#Caesar calls the Egyptians inferior to the Romans. Outraged
column2: Cleopatra wagers that her people can build a grand monument in record time.

column1: 7#1966#Asterix and the Big Fight#Le combat des chefs#Asterix's village (no travel)#The Romans conspire with a Roman-friendly Gaulish village to declare a ritual winner-takes-all fight between village chiefs. A blow from one of Obelix's menhirs causes Getafix to lose his memory
column2: leaving the Gauls without magic potion.

column1: 8#1966#Asterix in Britain#Astérix chez les Bretons#Britain#One small village in Britain still holds out against the Roman invaders. But with no magic potion
column2: they need help
column3: so Asterix's cousin Anticlimax comes to Gaul seeking aid.

column1: 9#1966#Asterix and the Normans#Astérix et les Normands#Asterix's village (no travel)#The Normans are fearless to the point of not even understanding the concept
column2: so they travel to Gaul where they kidnap chief Vitalstatistix's cowardly visiting nephew Justforkix to teach them fear.

column1: 10#1967#Asterix the Legionary#Astérix légionnaire#Africa#Asterix and Obelix join the Roman Legion (in a parody of the French Foreign Legion) in an attempt to find the conscripted fiancé of Panacea
column2: a villager on whom Obelix has a big crush.

column1: 11#1968#Asterix and the Chieftain's Shield#Le bouclier Arverne#Cities in southern France: Acqua Calidae (Vichy)
column2: Gergovia
column4: chief Vitalstatistix is forced to visit a spa in the Arvernian countryside to nurse his sore liver.

column1: 12#1968#Asterix at the Olympic Games#Astérix aux Jeux Olympiques#Greece#To participate in the Olympic Games in Greece
column2: the Gauls register themselves as Romans. When the officials declare the magic potion to be a form of illegal doping
column3: Asterix turns to his native abilities to compete.

column1: 13#1969#Asterix and the Cauldron#Astérix et le chaudron#Condatum (Rennes)#Whosemoralsarelastix
column2: chief of a nearby village
column3: asks Vitalstatistix to hide his village's money to prevent the Romans from taking it. When the money is stolen under his watch
column4: Asterix is banished until he can repay the money and recover his honour.

column1: 14#1969#Asterix in Spain#Astérix en Hispanie#Spain#Pepe
column2: the young and obstinate son of a Spanish chieftain
column3: is kidnapped by the Romans and sent to Gaul. Asterix and Obelix rescue him and escort him back to Spain.

column1: 15#1970#Asterix and the Roman Agent#La Zizanie#Asterix's village (no travel)#A troublemaker is brought to Caesar in Rome; he was to be executed in the Colosseum
column2: but is so conniving that the lions ate each other instead.

column1: 16#1970#Asterix in Switzerland#Astérix chez les Helvètes#Switzerland#A poisoned Roman tax inspector is given sanctuary in the Village. Asterix and Obelix are sent to Switzerland to recover a silver star flower
column2: or edelweiss
column3: which is needed to cure him.

column1: 17#1971#The Mansions of the Gods#Le Domaine des dieux#Asterix's village (no travel)#Caesar tries to dilute solidarity and weaken local customs in Gaul by creating a vacation resort near the Village. The villagers sabotage the plan
column2: first by magically replanting trees at the building site
column3: and by creating a slaves' union; later by being obnoxious neighbors to the resident Romans.

column1: 18#1972#Asterix and the Laurel Wreath#Les Lauriers de César#Rome#Thoroughly chagrined by his obnoxious brother-in-law
column2: Vitalstatistix gets drunk and boasts he will create a dish seasoned with Caesar's laurel wreath.

column1: 19#1972#Asterix and the Soothsayer#Astérix en Corse#Asterix's village (no travel)#"In the absence of Getafix
column2: a fraudulent seer seeks shelter in the Village during a storm. Camped in the forest
column3: he makes predictions the villagers want to hear and asks them to provide items (food
column4: alcohol and money) from which to ""read"" the future."

column1: 20#1973#Asterix in Corsica#le devin#Corsica#As part of celebrations of the anniversary of Vercingetorix's victory at the Battle of Gergovia
column2: the Gauls and their friends raid one of the nearby Roman camps.

column1: 21#1974#Asterix and Caesar's Gift#Le Cadeau de César#Asterix's village#At the end of their career
column2: legionaries are granted plots of land in Roman colonies for retirement. A perpetually inebriated soldier is given the Village
column4: which he promptly sells to an innkeeper for wine.

column1: 22#1975#Asterix and the Great Crossing#La Grande traversée#North America and Denmark#Brewing the magic potion requires fresh fish
column2: and Unhygienix has none since he imports them from Lutetia (Paris) (despite living by the sea).

column1: 23*#1976#Asterix Conquers Rome#Les 12 Travaux D'Asterix#various locations#To prove to his critics that the Gauls are mere mortals
column2: Julius Caesar challenges the village to perform twelve tasks that only gods could perform
column3: similar to the twelve tasks of Hercules.

column1: 23#1976#Obelix and Co.#Obélix et Compagnie#Asterix's village (no travel)#Caesar sends one of his advisors to the Gaulish village
column2: in an effort to make them rich
column3: decadent and utterly dependent on Rome.

column1: 24#1979#Asterix in Belgium#Astérix chez les Belges#Belgium#When Vitalstatistix hears that Caesar has said the Belgians are the bravest of all the Gaulish peoples he heads to Belgium in a huff to show the world that his Armoricans are really the best.
32#2003#Asterix and the Class Act#Astérix et la rentrée gauloise#Most stories take place in Asterix's village#A collection of several short stories
column2: including an experiment at different drawing and storytelling styles. Most stories are written by Goscinny.

column1: 34#2009#Asterix and Obelix's Birthday: The Golden Book#L'Anniversaire d'Astérix et Obélix- le Livre d'Or##Several short stories
column2: including some written by Goscinny.
